qas.question: Who was the Portugal Prime Minister in 2013?
What did the Prime Minister announce during the first week of May in 2013?

answers.text: significant government plan for the public sector, whereby 30,000 jobs will be cut and the number of weekly working hours will be increased from 35 to 40 hours

qas.question: For what reason did Prime Minister Passos Coelho justify cutting 30000 jobs?

answers.text: austerity measures are necessary if Portugal seeks to avoid another monetary bailout grant

qas.question: From which entities did Portugal seek a monetary bailout from?

answers.text: European Commission, European Central Bank and International Monetary Fund

context: In the first week of May 2013, Prime Minister <a0_0>Passos Coelho<a0_0/> announced a <a1_0>significant government plan for the public sector, whereby 30,000 jobs will be cut and the number of weekly working hours will be increased from 35 to 40 hours<a1_0/>. Coelho reaffirmed the announcement by explaining that <a2_0>austerity measures are necessary if Portugal seeks to avoid another monetary bailout grant<a2_0/> from the <a3_0>European Commission, European Central Bank and International Monetary Fund<a3_0/>—the overall plan intends to enact further cuts of €4.8 billion over a three-year period.
